en: And the whole earth was of one language and of one speech.
hmr: Chun, hnuoia mi po po chu ṭawng hmunkhat le thu hril dân hmunkhat an ni vawng a.

en: And it came to pass, as they journeyed east, that they found a plain in the land of Shinar; and they dwelt there.
hmr: Chun, hieng hi a na, khawsak tienga an insawn pei lai chun Sinar ramah phaizâwl an hmuh a; chutaka chun umhmun an khuor tah a.

en: And they said one to another, Come, let us make brick, and burn them thoroughly. And they had brick for stone, and slime had they for mortar.
hmr: “Thaw ro, ṭêklei siem ei tiu, ṭhatakin rawng ei tiu,” an inti tâwl a. Chuongchun, lung aiah ṭêklei chu an siem a, lungchârna aiah lawnghnai an nei bawk a.

en: And they said, Come, let us build us a city, and a tower, whose top may reach unto heaven, and let us make us a name; lest we be scattered abroad upon the face of the whole earth.
hmr: Chun, “Thaw ro, khawpui siem ei ta, in insâng a sîpin vân tawng dingin bâwl bawk ei tiu a, ei hming sukthang ei tiu; chuong naw chun hnuoi chung po poa hin sukdarin um rawi ei tih,” an in tih a.

en: And Jehovah came down to see the city and the tower, which the children of men builded.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chu mihriem nauhaiin khawpui le in insâng an siem vêl chu en dingin a zu ṭum a.

en: And Jehovah said, Behold, they are one people, and they have all one language; and this is what they begin to do: and now nothing will be withholden from them, which they purpose to do.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun, “Ngai ta u, mihai hi pumkhat an nih a, an rêngin ṭawng hmunkhat an nei bawk sih a; hi thil an thaw phut a ni hi; tuhin chu an thilthaw tum hrim hrim hi khappêk ruol ni ta naw ni hai.

en: Come, let us go down, and there confound their language, that they may not understand one another’s speech.
hmr: Thaw ro, zu fêng ei tiu a, ṭawng an inhriettuo thei nawna dingin khutaka khun an ṭawng zu suk- tumpêk ei tiu,” a ta.

en: So Jehovah scattered them abroad from thence upon the face of all the earth: and they left off building the city.
hmr: Chuongchun, LALPAIN anni chu chutaka inthawk chun hnuoi chung po poa chun a sukdar tah a; chuongchun, an khaw siem khawm chu an tâwpsan tah a.

en: Therefore was the name of it called Babel; because Jehovah did there confound the language of all the earth: and from thence did Jehovah scatter them abroad upon the face of all the earth.
hmr: Chuleichun, a hming chu Babel an tih a; LALPAIN chutaka chun hnuoia mi po po ṭawng chu a suktumpêk ta leiin: chutaka inthawk chun LALPAIN anni chu hnuoi chung po poa chun a sukdar ta bawk a.

en: These are the generations of Shem. Shem was a hundred years old, and begat Arpachshad two years after the flood:
hmr: Hienghai hi Sem thlahai chu an nih: Sem chu kum za mi a niin tui lêt hnung kum hni hnunga chun naupasal Arpaksad a nei a:

en: and Shem lived after he begat Arpachshad five hundred years, and begat sons and daughters.
hmr: Chun, Arpaksad a nei hnung chun Sem chu kum za nga a la dam a, naunuhmei le naupasalhai a nei nâwk a.

en: And Arpachshad lived five and thirty years, and begat Shelah:
hmr: Arpaksad chun kum sâwmthum le panga a niin naupasal Selah a nei a:

en: and Arpachshad lived after he begat Shelah four hundred and three years, and begat sons and daughters.
hmr: Selah a nei hnung chun Arpaksad chu kum za li le pathum a la dam a, naunuhmei le naupasalhai a nei nâwk a.

en: And Shelah lived thirty years, and begat Eber:
hmr: Selah chun kum sâwmthum a niin naupasal Eber a nei a:

en: and Shelah lived after he begat Eber four hundred and three years, and begat sons and daughters.
hmr: Eber a nei hnung chun Selah chu kum za li le pathum a la dam a, naunuhmei le naupasalhai a nei nâwk a.

en: And Eber lived four and thirty years, and begat Peleg:
hmr: Eber chun kum sâwmthum le pali a niin naupasal Peleg a nei a:

en: and Eber lived after he begat Peleg four hundred and thirty years, and begat sons and daughters.
hmr: Peleg a nei hnung chun Eber chu kum za li le sâwmthum a la dam a, naunuhmei le naupasalhai a nei nâwk a.

en: And Peleg lived thirty years, and begat Reu:
hmr: Peleg chun kum sâwmthum a niin naupasal Reu a nei a:

en: and Peleg lived after he begat Reu two hundred and nine years, and begat sons and daughters.
hmr: Reu a nei hnungin Peleg chu kum za hni le pakuo a la dam a, naunuhmei le naupasalhai a nei nâwk a.

en: And Reu lived two and thirty years, and begat Serug:
hmr: Reu chun kum sâwmthum le pahni a niin naupasal Serug a nei a:

en: and Reu lived after he begat Serug two hundred and seven years, and begat sons and daughters.
hmr: Serug a nei hnungin Reu chu kum za hni le pasari a la dam a, naunuhmei le naupasalhai a nei nâwk a.

en: And Serug lived thirty years, and begat Nahor:
hmr: Serug chun kum sâwmthum a niin naupasal Nahor a nei a:

en: and Serug lived after he begat Nahor two hundred years, and begat sons and daughters.
hmr: Nahor a nei hnungin Serug chu kum za hni a la dam a, naunuhmei le naupasalhai a nei nâwk a.

en: And Nahor lived nine and twenty years, and begat Terah:
hmr: Nahor chun kum sâwmhni le pakuo a niin naupasal Tera a nei a:

en: and Nahor lived after he begat Terah a hundred and nineteen years, and begat sons and daughters.
hmr: Tera a nei hnungin Nahor chu kum za khat le sâwm le pakuo a la dam a, naunuhmei le naupasalhai a nei nâwk a.

en: And Terah lived seventy years, and begat Abram, Nahor, and Haran.
hmr: Chun, Tera chun kum sâwmsari a niin naupasal Abram, Nahor le Haran a nei a.

en: Now these are the generations of Terah. Terah begat Abram, Nahor, and Haran; and Haran begat Lot.
hmr: Chun, hienghai hi Tera thlahai chu an nih. Tera chun naupasal Abram, Nahor le Haran a nei a. Haran chun naupasal Lota a nei a.

en: And Haran died before his father Terah in the land of his nativity, in Ur of the Chaldees.
hmr: Haran chu a piengna rama Kaldaihai khuo Urah, a pa Tera hmaa chun a thih a.

en: And Abram and Nahor took them wives: the name of Abram’s wife was Sarai; and the name of Nahor’s wife, Milcah, the daughter of Haran, the father of Milcah, and the father of Iscah.
hmr: Chun, Abram le Nahor chun nuhmei an nei a; Abram nuhmei hming chu Sarai a na; Nahor nuhmei hming chu Milka le Iska pa Haran naunu Milka a nih.

en: And Sarai was barren; she had no child.
hmr: Chun, Sarai chu a ching a, nau hrim a nei nawh a.

en: And Terah took Abram his son, and Lot the son of Haran, his son’s son, and Sarai his daughter-in-law, his son Abram’s wife; and they went forth with them from Ur of the Chaldees, to go into the land of Canaan; and they came unto Haran, and dwelt there.
hmr: Tera chun a naupa Abram le, a naupa naupasal (Haran naupa) Lota le, a mo, a naupa Abram nuhmei Sarai chu a ṭhuoi a; Kanaana fe dingin Kaldaihai khuo Ura inthawk chun an suok tlâng tah a; nisienlakhawm, Haran an hung tlung a, chutaka chun umhmun an khuor tah a.

en: And the days of Terah were two hundred and five years: and Terah died in Haran.
hmr: Tera dam sûng chu kum za hni le panga a nih; chun, Tera chu Harana chun a thi tah a.
